summary.para: Contains flags that describe a video stream.
These flags are used in the structure, which is part of the structure.

member.name: MFVideoFlags.MFVideoFlag_PAD_TO_Mask
member.summary: Use this value to mask out the next three flags, which describe the effective aspect ratio of the image. This value by itself is not a valid flag.

member.name: MFVideoFlags.MFVideoFlag_PAD_TO_None
member.summary: Do not modify the picture aspect ratio.

member.name: MFVideoFlags.MFVideoFlag_PAD_TO_4x3
member.summary: Display the image in a 4 x 3 area. If this flag is set, the geometrical aperture of the picture should be expanded to a 4 x 3 area by letterboxing or pillarboxing. The geometrical aperture is the portion of the image that is intended to be viewed, without any overscan region.

member.name: MFVideoFlags.MFVideoFlag_PAD_TO_16x9
member.summary: Display the image in a 16 x 9 area. If this flag is set, the geometrical aperture of the picture should be expanded to a 16 x 9 area by letterboxing or pillarboxing.

member.name: MFVideoFlags.MFVideoFlag_SrcContentHintMask
member.summary: Use this value to mask out the next three flags, which describe the source content. This value by itself is not a valid flag.

member.name: MFVideoFlags.MFVideoFlag_SrcContentHintNone
member.summary: There is no additional information about the source content .

member.name: MFVideoFlags.MFVideoFlag_SrcContentHint16x9
member.summary: The source is a 16 x 9 image encoded within a 4 x 3 area.

member.name: MFVideoFlags.MFVideoFlag_SrcContentHint235_1
member.summary: The source is a 2.35:1 image encoded within a 16 x 9 or 4 x 3 area.

member.name: MFVideoFlags.MFVideoFlag_AnalogProtected
member.summary: Analog copy protection should be applied.

member.name: MFVideoFlags.MFVideoFlag_DigitallyProtected
member.summary: Digital copy protection should be applied.

member.name: MFVideoFlags.MFVideoFlag_ProgressiveContent
member.summary: The video source is progressive content encoded as interlaced video, possibly using 3:2 pulldown. This flag is obsolete. See Remarks.

member.name: MFVideoFlags.MFVideoFlag_FieldRepeatCountMask
member.summary: Used to extract the field repeat count. This flag is obsolete. See Remarks.

member.name: MFVideoFlags.MFVideoFlag_FieldRepeatCountShift
member.summary: Used to extract the field repeat count. This flag is obsolete. See Remarks.

member.name: MFVideoFlags.MFVideoFlag_ProgressiveSeqReset
member.summary: The progressive sequence was disrupted and the sequence is interlaced at the break. This flag is obsolete. See Remarks.

member.name: MFVideoFlags.MFVideoFlag_PanScanEnabled
member.summary: Apply the pan and scan rectangle on the output.

member.name: MFVideoFlags.MFVideoFlag_LowerFieldFirst
member.summary: The sample contains the lower field. This flag applies only if the interlace mode is single fields (MFVideoInterlace_FieldSingleUpperFirst or MFVideoInterlace_FieldSingleLowerFirst). This flag is obsolete. See Remarks.

member.name: MFVideoFlags.MFVideoFlag_BottomUpLinearRep
member.summary: The image is represented bottom-up in memory. This flag should be used only with RGB formats.

member.name: MFVideoFlags.MFVideoFlags_DXVASurface
member.summary: Reserved. Do not use.

member.name: MFVideoFlags.MFVideoFlags_RenderTargetSurface
member.summary: Reserved. Do not use.

member.name: MFVideoFlags.MFVideoFlags_ForceQWORD
member.summary: Reserved. This member forces the enumeration type to compile as a QWORD value.
